member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Presets.ByWorkspacePathAndSliderNames(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Creates Presets of all possible combinations of any given Integer Slider values within a Dynamo workspace and adds them to the original workspace file.
member.param: The path to the .dyn file.
The names of the Integer Sliders. If more than one Slider has the same name, the node will iterate through all of them.
member.returns: The dynFilePath with the added Presets.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Presets.ByWorkspacePathSliderNamesAndNewPath(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Creates Presets of all possible combinations of any given Integer Slider values within a Dynamo workspace and adds them to a new preset file.
member.param: The path to the .dyn file.
The names of the Integer Sliders. If more than one Slider has this name, the will be all iterated.
File path for the new preset file.
member.returns: The path of the new preset file.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Presets.Clear(System.String)
member.summary: Remove all Presets from a specified file
member.param: The path to the .dyn file.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.GetDynamoVersion
member.returns: The first three digits of the active Dynamo version.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.BuildJournalStart
member.summary: Builds the first part of the journal string
member.returns: The first part of the journal string.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.BuildJournalEnd
member.summary: Builds the last part of the journal string
member.returns: The last part of the journal string.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.BuildProjectOpen(System.String)
member.summary: Builds the part of the journal string responsible for opening a project
member.param: The path to the Revit file. This can be an .rvt or .rfa file.
member.returns: The part of the journal string responsible for opening a project.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.BuildProjectClose
member.summary: Builds the part of the journal string responsible for closing a project
member.returns: The part of the journal string responsible for closing a project.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.BuildLaunchDynamo(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the part of the journal string responsible for launching DynamoRevit
member.param: The path to the Dynamo workspace.
The version number of Revit (e.g. 2017).
The version number of Dynamo (e.g. 1.3).
member.returns: The part of the journal string responsible for launching DynamoRevit.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.DeleteJournalFile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the journal file if it already exists.
member.param: The path of the generated journal file.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.ByWorkspacePath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Create a journal file for executing a Dynamo workspace on a Revit file.
This journal file uses several keys specifically for the purpose of automating Dynamo. Dynamo is never run in the idle loop. The workspace is executed immediately, and control is returned to the DynamoRevit external application.
member.param: The path to the Revit file. This can be an .rvt or .rfa file.
The path to the Dynamo workspace.
The path of the generated journal file.
The version number of Revit (e.g. 2017).
member.returns: The path of the generated journal file.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.ByModelPathsWorkspacePath(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Create a journal file for executing a Dynamo workspace on multiple Revit file in one continuous Revit session.
This journal file uses several keys specifically for the purpose of automating Dynamo. Dynamo is never run in the idle loop. The workspace is executed immediately, and control is returned to the DynamoRevit external application.
member.param: The paths to the Revit files. These can be .rvt or .rfa files.
The path to the Dynamo workspace.
The path of the generated journal file.
The version number of Revit (e.g. 2017).
member.returns: The path of the generated journal file.

member.name: M:ProcessRunner.Process.ByPathAndArguments(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Run a process and return the exit code.
member.param: The path to the process to execute.
The command line arguments to the process.
member.returns: The exit code for the process.
